description.narrative: Strengthened sector coordination mechanisms through the SWAp and other fora to ensure national budgets, policies, strategies and M&E plans prioritize vulnerable groups to reduce disparities in Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) service access, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) - Capacities and alliances for strategic coordination are strengthened and equity and disaster risk reduction focused policies and systems developed for sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) service delivery

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened sector coordination mechanisms through the SWAp and other fora to ensure national budgets, policies, strategies andM&E plans prioritize vulnerable groups to reduce disparities in WASH service access

description.narrative: Sector coordination mechanisms continued to be operational throughout the year with some fora constrained by internal restructuring of the National Directorate of Water Supply and Sanitation. The PRONASAR SWAp was challenged by the macro-economic crisis though the Common Fund survived through successful advocacy of UNICEF | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:18/01/2017

title.narrative: Sector coordination mechanisms (Joint Annual Review, PRONASAR Common Fund Group, Water Sector Partners Group, UNDAF WASH Sub-group, WASH Cluster, GAS) annually co-chaired and/or actively supported
US$ and % government expenditure on WASH

target.value: 2016:This is an area of priority in 2016 but realistic targets are still under development

actual.value: 2016:WASH sector budget analysis showed 2016 government allocation of US$ 147,5 million, (representing 2.8% of government budget), however, 2016 expenditures will only be available in March 2017.

title.narrative: National Rural Sanitation Strategy developed and approved

actual.value: 2016:TOR for development of rural sanitation strategy approved by the sanitation multi-sectorial group (which includes key sector: WASH, Education, Health, Finance, Environment, Local Administration). Contracting of international consultant planned for 2017.
